episodes.title: Mykelti & Tony: Growing Up Polygamist & the Real Sister Wives S20 Tea
episodes.description:
Mykelti & Tony's Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/u85780932

In this episode, we sit down with Mykelti Brown Padron, daughter of Kody and Christine Brown, and her husband Tony for an open and honest conversation about growing up in polygamy.

Mykelti shares what it was really like being raised in a plural family, how that upbringing shaped her views on relationships, and how it affected her and Tony while they were dating. Together, they reflect on what they believe about polygamy today and ask the big question—can polygamy ever truly be successful?

We also dive into Sister Wives Season 20, asking the questions fans really want answered. Mykelti gives her perspective on the family dynamics, the changes we’re seeing on screen, and what could be coming next.

This conversation is thoughtful, honest, and full of insight—straight from someone who lived it.

episodes.title: Fact or Feelings? Coyote Pass Contracts & Kody Saying He “Did Love” Christine | S20 Tell-All Pt. 1&2
episodes.description:
In this video, we react to Sister Wives Season 20 Tell-All Part 1 and break down two of the biggest moments from the episode.

We talk about the sale of Coyote Pass and how each person involved seems to remember the contracts and agreements very differently. The conflicting stories raise real questions about communication, accountability, and what actually happened behind the scenes.

We also discuss the uncomfortable moment when Kody says he “did love” Christine, and why that statement didn’t sit well with Christine or David. Is that about lingering feelings, or is it simply a statement of past fact? We share our perspective on why wording matters — especially after everything that’s happened.

Let us know what you think:
Do you believe the Coyote Pass stories add up, and was Kody’s comment about loving Christine harmless or inappropriate?

episodes.title: Kody and Meri’s Intense Conversation | Basement Wives & Spiritual Releases SW S20 E14 Reaction
episodes.description:
In this episode of Sister Wives Season 20, Episode 14, we react to Kody and Meri’s intense one-on-one conversation and break down why his apology feels so complicated, loaded, and hard to watch. From years of emotional distance to unresolved power dynamics, this meeting says a lot about where their relationship truly stands.

We also dive into the idea of “basement wives” and how that label reflects deeper patterns of hierarchy, neglect, and worth inside polygamous marriages. On top of that, we talk about Janelle’s desire for a spiritual release—and why, in fundamentalist Mormonism, religious permission can feel just as important as emotional closure.

As former members of Mormon and Mormon fundamentalist communities, we share personal insight into how faith, control, and loyalty shape these conversations—and why walking away isn’t always as simple as it looks from the outside.

Let us know your thoughts in the comments. Did Kody’s apology feel sincere to you? And should Janelle still need a spiritual release to move on?

episodes.title: Kody’s Apology Tour: David Speaks Up, Meri’s Next, and Janelle’s Spiritual Release | SW S20 E13
episodes.description: In this episode, we react to Kody’s apology to Christine — a conversation that quickly shifts when David steps in to advocate for his wife. David pushes Kody to focus less on his own feelings and more on repairing relationships with his children, something Kody clearly isn’t comfortable hearing. We also talk about what’s next in Kody’s ongoing “apology tour,” with Meri expected to be next, and why Janelle still feels she needs a spiritual release before she can truly move on. Drawing from our own experiences in fundamentalist Mormon belief systems, we break down why that release may still hold deep spiritual meaning for Janelle — even after everything she’s been through. As always, we share our honest reactions, personal insight, and unpack the religious and emotional dynamics at play in this moment of Sister Wives. episodes.title: Kody Finally Apologizes to Janelle | SW S20 Ep11 Reaction
episodes.description:
In this week’s Sister Wives Season 20 Episode 11 reaction, we break down Kody’s long-awaited apology to Janelle — and why she was the one he chose to talk to first. We talk about the grace, patience, and kindness Janelle shows him in this moment, and what it says about their history and the dynamics in the Brown family.

We also dive into Meri’s painfully awkward dating event, where she’s trying to move forward but the energy is… rough. And we cover Christine’s hesitation to meet with Kody, even as she leans toward doing it for the sake of her children.

As always, we bring our perspectives as former Mormon and former FLDS members to unpack the religious, emotional, and family dynamics playing out in this episode.

episodes.title: Self-Serving Apologies & Spiritual Callings | Sister Wives S20 Ep10 Reaction
episodes.description:
In our reaction to Sister Wives Season 20 Episode 10, we take a close look at Kody’s sudden desire to “apologize” to his ex-wives — and why it doesn’t feel like the sincere accountability he thinks it is. Instead of owning the hurt he caused, Kody seems more interested in apologizing on his terms, in his timing, and in a way that centers his comfort rather than the women he hurt.

We also touch on Janelle’s background and how she came to join Mormon fundamentalism, but only as context for how deeply these relationships were rooted for her.

episodes.title: Coyote Pass Cold Shoulder & Kody’s ‘I Want a Relationship With My Kids’ Claim | Sister Wives S20 E9
episodes.description:
In this week’s Sister Wives Season 20 Episode 9, we react to the Coyote Pass standoff where Kody and Robyn can’t even be bothered to say hi or goodbye to Janelle and Meri.

We also talk about Christine and David’s spa day, and how Christine is continuing to grow and learn communication in a monogamous relationship — something completely new after decades in plural marriage. And of course, Janelle’s girls trip to New Orleans, where she finally lets her hair down and admits she needs a spiritual release from Kody before she can truly move on.

But the biggest question of the episode? Kody claims he wants to repair his relationships with his children…
Is he being genuine, or is he just saying it because the cameras are rolling?

episodes.title: Mormon Dances, Weddings & ‘Enduring to the End’ | Sister Wives S20 Ep 7 Reaction
episodes.description:
In this week’s episode of Sister Wives, we couldn’t help but notice how uncomfortable things felt between Kody and Robyn — especially during those dancing moments. It brought back memories of Mormon church dances and wedding receptions, including our own, and how deeply those experiences reflect the culture we grew up in.

We also dive into how polygamy and Mormonism often frame jealousy and suffering as spiritual growth — that women are supposed to overcome jealousy to “become better,” and that faith means learning to endure to the end. But what happens when “enduring” starts to mean not living?

Join us as we react to Sister Wives Season 20, Episode 7 and talk about the deeper beliefs behind the culture — where joy is often postponed for a promised reward in the next life.

episodes.title: Growing Up Under Scientology’s Control w/ @JennaMiscavige ​
episodes.description:
In this exclusive interview, we sit down with Jenna Miscavige, the niece of Scientology leader David Miscavige, to hear her powerful story of growing up inside one of the world’s most secretive organizations.

Jenna shares how, at just two years old, she was separated from her parents, who were both Sea Org members, and grew up with almost no time with them. From the age of 6 to 12, she lived in Scientology’s Cadet Organization, under strict rules, separation from family, and relentless indoctrination. By the age of 12, Jenna herself was recruited into the Sea Org, signing away her life to Scientology’s most elite and demanding order.

Through Jenna’s story, we uncover what daily life looked like for children inside Scientology, the intense pressure of the Sea Org, and the lasting impact of being raised under such extreme control.

Whether you’re curious about Scientology, high-demand groups, or stories of resilience and escape, Jenna’s journey offers an inside look few have ever experienced.

episodes.title: Wolves Among Us: Spotting Predators Who Blend Into Everyday Life w/ Mike King from Profiling Evil
episodes.description:
In this eye-opening interview, we sit down with criminal profiler and author Mike King to talk about his powerful new book, Wolves in Sheep's Clothing. With decades of experience tracking and studying predators, Mike reveals how these individuals skillfully blend into our schools, churches, neighborhoods, and even our workplaces.

We dive into the chilling reality that "predators don’t always lurk in the shadows—sometimes, they sit in our pews or work in the next cubicle." Mike shares real-life examples, the psychology behind predatory behavior, and most importantly, how everyday people can recognize the warning signs and protect themselves and others.

If you’ve ever thought, “I’d know a predator if I saw one,” this conversation may change your mind.

episodes.title: Polygamy Only Works Without Love? | Final Sister Wives One-on-One Reactions
episodes.description: The Sister Wives experiment is officially over—and the final one-on-one interviews say it all. Janelle admits she never would’ve married Kody if they had just dated first. episodes.description: We’re reacting to the shocking true story of the Bergholz Clan, a radical Amish cult led by a man who declared himself a prophet and claimed only he could interpret the Bible. As control tightened, the group began attacking other Amish men and women, forcibly cutting off their sacred hair and beards—a deep act of humiliation in Amish culture. The leader even took photos of the attacks, which ultimately helped land him in prison. This story is told by his former right-hand man, who bravely left the group—but is still shunned by his family to this day. Different group. episodes.title: Escaping the Kingston Group: Lu Ann’s Fight for Freedom & Hope After Polygamy
episodes.description: At just 15 years old, Lu Ann Cooper was forced to marry her first cousin within the Kingston Group—also known as “The Order.” Trapped in a system of control, secrecy, and abuse, Luann felt suicide was her only way out. Leaving wasn’t even an option—until one day, it was. In this powerful interview, Lu Ann opens up about her heartbreaking experience as a child bride, the emotional and psychological toll of life inside the Kingston cult, and what gave her the courage to finally escape. Today, Lu Ann is not only a survivor—she's a leader. She co-founded Hope After Polygamy, a nonprofit that provides scholarships and support to others leaving polygamous groups. ✨ This is a story of pain, resilience, and purpose. 🎓 Learn how Luann is helping others reclaim their education and their future. 🔔 Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and share to support more survivor stories and raise awareness about life after polygamy. episodes.title: American Primeval: Unpacking the Dark Truths of Mormon History
episodes.description: Netflix’s American Primeval dives into the brutal realities of the American frontier, including the complex and often violent relationships between Mormon settlers, the U.S. Army, and Native American tribes. While the show is historical fiction, it clearly portrays Brigham Young and early Mormon leaders as religious extremists willing to do anything—massacres included—to preserve their theocracy. The show brings to light some of the darkest chapters in Mormon history, including the infamous Mountain Meadows Massacre, where men, women, and children were slaughtered under the guise of religious loyalty. But how much of this portrayal is based on real history? Join us as we break down the historical events that likely inspired American Primeval, separate fact from fiction, and discuss the brutal truths that shaped the early Mormon settlements in the West. episodes.title: 4 Seconds Cost Me $5 Million | My Beast Games Elimination
episodes.description: In Episode 3 of Beast Games, Sam faced the toughest moment of his journey. He and two of his closest allies were forced to make an impossible choice—one of them had to self-sacrifice by cuffing themselves to a wall so the other two could move forward. But when the chosen teammate struggled to accept the result and took too long to put on the cuffs, time ran out—by just 4 seconds—eliminating all three of them from the competition. episodes.title: Renovating "The Phoenix Room" at the Short Creek Dream Center with Your Donations
episodes.description:
In this video, we take you behind the scenes of an incredible transformation made possible by your generous donations! Together, we renovated a men's common room at the Short Creek Dream Center, turning it into a warm, inspiring, and welcoming space now known as "The Phoenix Room."

What makes this project even more meaningful is the history of the building. The Short Creek Dream Center is located in the very house where Warren Jeffs, the FLDS leader, once lived. Today, it stands as a beacon of hope, healing, and new beginnings for those escaping polygamy and seeking a better life.

Your support made this possible, and we can’t thank you enough! 💛

episodes.title: From Polygamy to Missionary: My Unlikely Journey
episodes.description: In this video, Melissa interviews Sam about his incredible journey from growing up in a polygamous FLDS community to serving as a Mormon missionary in Chile. episodes.title: From FLDS Polygamy to LDS Faith: My Journey of Belief and Belonging
episodes.description: In this video, Sam shares the incredible story of leaving the FLDS (Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints) community, where he was raised with four mothers and Warren Jeffs as the prophet. At just 18 years old, Sam made the life-changing decision to walk away from everything he knew, waking up on a stranger's couch with no plan for what was next. Join us as Melissa interviews Sam about his journey from a strict polygamous upbringing to discovering the mainstream LDS (Mormon) Church. episodes.title: Life Inside FLDS Polygamy: Growing Up with 4 Moms and Warren Jeffs as Prophet
episodes.description: In this video, Sam opens up about his unique and complex journey growing up in the FLDS (Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints) community. With Warren Jeffs as the prophet and four mothers all married to his father, Sam’s childhood was filled with both cherished memories and challenging experiences. Sam shares what life was really like inside a polygamous household, from the daily routines with his large family to interactions with the influential Jeffs family, including visits to their home. He dives into the good parts of his upbringing, like working together in the family garden, but also reveals the darker realities of life within the FLDS church. episodes.title: Exclusive Interview: Ex-AUB Members share Inside Scoop on Sister Wives and the Brown Family
episodes.description: In this exclusive interview, Sam (Ex-FLDS) and Melissa (raised LDS) sit down with Melanie and Cory, two former members of the AUB (Apostolic United Brethren) church—the same polygamous group the Brown family from Sister Wives came from. Melanie, the daughter of the current AUB prophet, and her husband Cory share their personal experiences and unique insights into Kody Brown and his four wives. Having known the family personally, Melanie and Cory provide an inside look into the real dynamics behind the show and the polygamous lifestyle portrayed on Sister Wives. 🔔 Don’t forget to subscribe for more interviews and reactions about polygamous communities, fundamentalist religions, and Sister Wives! 00:00:00 Did Cody Really Love Mary? 00:06:14 Discussion on Cody's Relationships and Choices 00:13:23 The Complexities of Legal Adoption in Polygamous Families 00:19:49 Mary's Journey in the Brown Family 00:26:00 Navigating Plural Relationships and Favoritism 00:32:11 The Challenges of Self-Governance in Restrictive Religions 00:38:40 Christine's Journey to Finding Love Again 00:44:48 Misalignment in Relationships 00:51:10 Community Secrets and Liberation 00:57:28 Conclusion and Thanks Join our NEW Patreon HERE: https://patreon.com/growingupinpolygamy If you or someone you love has left polygamy and needs assistance, please reach out to "Holding Out HELP" at 801-548-3492 or visit their website at www.holdingouthelp.org At Growing Up In Polygamy our mission is to "Create compassion for communities that have been misunderstood, marginalized and/or abused by their leaders, and to empower those who have left by giving them a platform to share their stories with the world." episodes.title: ESCAPING the AUB: Prophet’s Daughter & Husband Share Their Journey Out of Polygamy
episodes.description: In this powerful interview, Sam and Melissa sit down with Melanie and Cory, a couple who bravely left the polygamous AUB (Apostolic United Brethren) church. Melanie, the daughter of the current prophet of the AUB, shares her harrowing experience of being married as a child bride within the church, and how she found the courage to escape in adulthood. episodes.title: The Mormon Word of Wisdom Explained! | The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives
episodes.description: In this video, Sam, an ex-member of the FLDS Church, and Melissa, who grew up in the mainstream LDS Church, break down the "Word of Wisdom" as seen in the new hit TV show The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives. We dive deep into the origins and significance of this health code, explaining its rules around coffee, tea, alcohol, and tobacco, and explore the cultural contradictions, like why soda is okay but coffee isn't. Sam and Melissa share their personal experiences with the "Word of Wisdom" from their unique perspectives, highlighting the challenges and hypocrisies they've seen in both fundamentalist and mainstream Mormon communities. Join us as we react to the show and shed light on what the "Word of Wisdom" really means for Mormons today! episodes.title: Polygamist with 5 Wives and 25 Kids: Living Polygamy While Exposing the Dangers of Fundamentalism
episodes.description: In this eye-opening interview, we sit down with Brady Williams, star of "My 5 Wives", who is currently living in a polygamous family with 5 wives and 25 children. Despite maintaining his polygamous lifestyle, he is now a vocal advocate against the dangers of religious fundamentalism—the very ideology that shaped his family. episodes.title: Ex-Polygamist Tests Google's AI: Gemini's Answers vs. My Real-Life Polygamy Experience
episodes.description: In this video, an ex-polygamist puts Google's AI assistant, Gemini, to the test by asking it questions about polygamy. Watch as he compares Gemini's responses with his own real-life experiences growing up in a polygamous community. How accurate is AI when it comes to understanding the complexities of polygamy? Does it capture the reality of life in these communities, or is there a gap between technology and lived experience? episodes.title: Escaping Polygamy's Grip: From FLDS First Wife to Advocate Against Abuse | Charlene's Journey
episodes.description:
Join us as we delve into the extraordinary life of Charlene, a woman who grew up in the complex world of polygamy, ultimately becoming the first wife of FLDS bishop, Lyle Jeffs. Her story is one of resilience, strength, and the pursuit of justice.

Charlene faced unimaginable challenges within her polygamous marriage, enduring persecution for daring to ask questions and challenge the status quo. Ignored by her husband and sent away from her children for seemingly trivial reasons, she found herself in a situation that demanded her to "repent" for hitting the snooze button on her alarm clock.

As she shares her remarkable journey, Charlene opens up about the hardships she endured within the FLDS community and her courageous decision to break free from the confines of polygamy. Today, she advocates against abuse and raises awareness about the dark realities hidden behind closed doors.

Discover the inspiring transformation of a woman who went from being a marginalized figure in a polygamous society to an empowered advocate for change. Learn more about her experiences, insights, and the motivation behind her new book, "Tell Your Heart to Beat Again."

Join us in shedding light on the untold stories of those who break free from oppressive situations, finding strength in adversity. Don't miss this eye-opening interview that explores the depths of human resilience and the power of raising awareness. Subscribe now to be part of this incredible journey of courage and redemption. #EscapePolygamy #SurvivorStories #TellYourHeartToBeatAgain

episodes.title: Growing Up In Polygamy: Elise's Story - Part 1
episodes.description:
Welcome Back!

In this interview we dive deep into the incredible life story of Elise, a courageous woman who grew up in the FLDS (Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints) community in Northern Utah. Elise's journey is a testament to the power of resilience and the indomitable spirit of the human soul.

Elise's upbringing was far from ordinary. Raised in a polygamous family within the FLDS community, she attended Alta Academy, a private school where Warren Jeffs, a controversial and infamous figure, served as the principal. This institution was not like your typical school, and the FLDS community had its own unique beliefs, practices, and way of life.

Throughout the video, Elise shares her personal experiences and struggles growing up in this tightly-knit, secretive community. She delves into the challenges she faced, the strict rules she had to follow, and the emotional toll it took on her as a young woman

If you're curious about the FLDS community, the challenges they face, and the strength it takes to break free, make sure to subscribe to our channel for more inspiring stories of resilience and transformation. Elise's story is one of hope, courage, and the pursuit of a life that's true to oneself.

episodes.title: Understanding FLDS Abuse and Labor Trafficking | A Survivor's Perspective
episodes.description:
Content Warning: This interview contains discussions of child abuse, labor exploitation, and other distressing topics related to the FLDS community. Viewer discretion is advised. Our intention is to inform and educate while respecting the survivor's bravery and strength in sharing their story.

In this powerful and heart-wrenching interview, we sit down with a courageous survivor who shares their harrowing journey out of the shadows of abuse and labor exploitation within the FLDS community. Their story sheds light on the hidden realities faced by vulnerable children and the challenges they encounter in escaping such traumatic situations.

Through this candid conversation, we aim to raise awareness about the dark and secretive world of FLDS abuse and labor trafficking, shedding light on the urgent need for awareness, empathy, and support for survivors. Join us as we listen to their account, learn about their resilience, and gain insight into the struggles they've faced on their path to healing and empowerment.

If you or someone you know is a survivor of abuse or trafficking and needs assistance, please reach out to the appropriate helpline or support organization in your region. Together, we can work towards a world where every child is safe and protected from harm.

If you or someone you love has left polygamy and needs assistance, please reach out to "Holding Out HELP" at 801-548-3492 or visit their website at www.holdingouthelp.org
